# elasticstack_kibana_security_exception_item (Resource)

Creates and manages Kibana exception list items. Exception items contain the actual exception logic (fields, values, operators) that prevent security detection rules from generating alerts when matched.



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `description` (String) A description of the exception item.
- `entries` (String) The exception entries as a JSON array. Each entry defines conditions (field, operator, value) that must match for the exception to apply. Use the jsontypes.Normalized custom type for proper JSON comparison.
- `list_id` (String) The list_id of the exception list (container) that this item belongs to.
- `name` (String) The name of the exception item.
- `type` (String) The type of exception item. Must match the type of the parent exception list. Valid values are: 'simple'.

### Optional

- `comments` (Attributes List) Array of comments about the exception item. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--comments))
- `expire_time` (String) The exception item's expiration date in ISO format (e.g., '2024-12-31T23:59:59Z'). This field is only available for regular exception items, not endpoint exceptions.
- `item_id` (String) The human-readable unique identifier for the exception item (e.g., 'trusted-linux-process'). If not provided, Kibana will generate one.
- `meta` (Attributes) Optional metadata about the exception item. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--meta))
- `namespace_type` (String) Determines whether the exception item is available in all Kibana spaces or just the space in which it is created. Valid values are: 'single' (only available in the space where created) or 'agnostic' (available in all spaces). Defaults to 'single'.
- `os_types` (List of String) Array of operating system types for which the exception item applies. Valid values include: 'linux', 'macos', 'windows'.
- `space_id` (String) The Kibana space ID where the exception item exists. Defaults to 'default'.
- `tags` (List of String) Array of tags to help categorize the exception item.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The unique identifier of the exception item. This is generated by Kibana.

<a id="nestedatt--comments"></a>
### Nested Schema for `comments`

Required:

- `comment` (String) The comment text.


<a id="nestedatt--meta"></a>
### Nested Schema for `meta`

Optional:

- `additional_properties` (Map of String) Additional metadata properties as key-value pairs.
